property.name: purpose
property.value:
PURPOSE of /CoreOS/distribution/Manpages/smoke Description: Makes sure man finds and displays manpages Author: Joe the Tester <jttester@redhat.com>
Test checks that man pages are readable by calling "man man" filtering escape codes from it's output and searching for expected strings using "grep -E". Additional man pages to check, as well as RegEx with expected strings, can be specified via parametrization.
For up to date parameters look inside runtest.sh!
To specify additional man pages to check define for example: CHECK_MAN_PAGES='bash less'
Manpages can be automatically looked for by specifying list of rpm packages: CHECK_MAN_RPMS='coreutils less'
Manpages can be also be sought for inside filesystem paths: CHECK_MAN_ROOTS='/opt/rh/nodejs010/ /usr/local/share'
If your man pages do not contain default strings use for example: CHECK_FOR='NonStandardText|NAME|DESCRIPTION'
For people testing just single collection package ------------------------------------------------- To make sure only single one collection is enabled and avoid situation where other collection could cover, possibly corrupted MANPATH, in a collection under test, it is suggested to define: ADD_STEPS='single_collection'

error.message: Checking for the presence of man rpm
